newsitem.title: SWEDEN: TENNIS-LARSSON TO MEET ROSSET IN OPENING SINGLES.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-LARSSON TO MEET ROSSET IN OPENING SINGLES.

text.p: Sweden, strongly favoured to beat Switzerland in their Davis Cup world group first round tie, will count on Magnus Larsson to deliver the first point when he faces Marc Rosset in the opening singles on Friday.
Swedish number one Thomas Enqvist, 22, will face Lorenzo Manta in the second singles for the second singles.
The unheralded Manta comes in to replace the now-retired Jakob Hlasek, 32, winner of five singles titles over a 14-year career.
Hlasek's absence hurts the Swiss though Sweden's non-playing captain Carl-Axel Hageskog refused to be over optimistic.
"It obviously looks better for us with Hlasek off their team, but there are no easy matches in Davis Cup," he warned.
"But it's so close between today's players that Enqvist or anybody at the top could lose to a player ranked around the 200 mark."
Mikael Tillstrom teams up with Nicklas Kulti to face Rosset and Manta in Saturday's doubles.
Sweden won the 1995 Davis Cup by beating Russia in the final in Moscow but lost last year's final 3-2 to France in Malmo.
The tie will be played on a slow plexi-pave surface in Lulea, 940 km (580 miles) north of Stockholm.
